title: Ayurvedic superfoods to add to your diet for boosting immunity | The Times of India
description: A robust immune system protects you from disease-causing microorganisms and reduces the risk of developing severe symptoms.
cleaned_text: can help to boost immunity The importance of building immunity has always been a topic of discussion. And now, when we are in the middle of a pandemic, people have started taking the issue more seriously. A robust immune system protects you from disease-causing microorganisms and reduces the risk of developing severe symptoms. It even helps to protect you from water and mosquito-borne diseases that are common in the rainy season. So, how do you build immunity? Honestly, building strong immunity isn't a difficult task. All you need to do is maintain some discipline and follow healthy eating habits. With a good diet consisting of natural produce, spices, herbs, and whole grains, a proper sleep schedule, and regular exercising, you can strengthen your internal system in no time. There are endless food items that you can add to your plate when your motto is to get fitter and healthier. Each food item is loaded with some special nutrient that can help your body work efficiently. Here we will focus upon some that are considered the healthiest options in Ayurveda. [readmore](javascript://) 02/8Gooseberry or Amla Indian gooseberry, or amla, is a fruit native to India. The tiny green fruit is the richest source of vitamins, a powerful antioxidant that helps to strengthen the body's natural defence system. Studies suggest that amla contains 20 times more Vitamin C than oranges, which makes it the healthiest food option. Other than that, this citric fruit also contains healthy nutrients like folate, vitamin A, calcium, copper, and zinc. Consuming amla can help to boost immunity, clean the colon, remove excess toxins from the body, clear skin, reduce hair fall and prevent acne. You can have amla as fruit or mix the juice in the water and drink it. [readmore](javascript://) 03/8Dates or Khajoor Ripe and dried dates are also an excellent source of vitamin C and Iron. Vitamin C helps and reduces respiratory problems, while iron supports your immune system to work efficiently. Iron is needed to make hemoglobin, a protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen from the lungs to all parts of the body. Besides, high polyphenols content in the body reduces inflammation and potassium, keeps your heart healthy. Having 2-3 pieces of dates in a day is enough to stay healthy. You can also use it as a replacement for sugar. [readmore](javascript://) 04/8Clarified butter or Ghee Who said ghee is fattening? Ghee or clarified butter is extremely nutritious and helps you stay healthy by supporting your immune system. This staple Indian food item is packed with the benefits of vitamin A, K, E, Omega-3, and Omega 9 essential fatty acids. Besides, it is also a source of healthy fat and butyrate. Ghee keeps your body warm, promotes digestion, improves eye health, moisturizes your skin from the inside, and reduces the issue of hair fall. Try to have one tablespoon of ghee with your meal. Make sure to eat ghee in moderation. [readmore](javascript://) 05/8Jaggery Commonly known as gud in Hindi, jaggery is a healthier alternative to sugar. Jaggery and sugar contain the same amount of calories, but the latter does not contain the nutrient. Jaggery is loaded with antioxidants and minerals like zinc and selenium. These minerals can help build resistance against infections and build stronger immunity. It is also packed with nutrients like iron, magnesium, and potassium. Jaggery can also help to cleanse your respiratory system. [readmore](javascript://) 06/8Tulsi leaves The health benefits of tulsi have been vouched by both science and Ayurveda. The green leaves found in every Indian household contain phytochemicals, flavonoids, and antioxidant compounds, such as rosmarinic acid. Together these compounds help to treat infections in the respiratory tract and strengthen the immune system. The leaves are also rich in vitamins A, C, and K and minerals like calcium, magnesium, phosphorus, iron, and potassium. You can chew some tulsi leaves every morning before your breakfast. [readmore](javascript://) 07/8Turmeric or Haldi Turmeric is a common spice found in every Indian kitchen. The yellow spice is known for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. The main compound in turmeric is curcumin, which is responsible for most of its potent health benefits. It can help to cleanse your respiratory system, improve digestion, prevent cancer, promote weight loss and help in healing wounds. Turmeric is also rich in nutrients like iron, copper manganese, zinc, phosphorus, and vitamin A, C, E, K. They may also prevent the body from the damage caused by free radicals. [readmore](javascript://) 08/8Ginger Ginger is a superfood that can help to provide relief from ailments including nausea, cold, flu, and cough. The anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties of this root can boost immune health and reduce acute inflammation in the body. Ginger is also packed with Vitamin A, K, copper, iron, and magnesium. Having ginger juice with some honey can promote digestion, fight the cold, prevent colon cancer, and cures the infection.
